Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Enum BleManagerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BleManagerState>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManagerState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BitwiseEnum, Flag, State, UsesCustomNull, Serializable, Comparable<BleManagerState>
    public enum BleManagerState
extends Enum<BleManagerState>
implements State
    An enumeration of the various states that a BleManager can be in. The manager can be in multiple states simultaneously.
    See Also:
    ManagerStateListener, BleManager.is(BleManagerState), BleManager.getStateMask()

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.State

        State.ChangeEvent<T_State extends State>, State.ChangeIntent

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      BLE_SCAN_READY
      This state dictates that all permissions (if needed) have been granted to allow BLE scanning to return results.
      BOOST_SCANNING
      This is the state that BleManager is in when BleManagerConfig.scanClassicBoostLength is not null, or Interval.DISABLED.
      IDLE
      This is the state that BleManager is in when the update loop tick interval has been lowered, due to there being no tasks in the queue for a time dictated by BleManagerConfig.minTimeToIdle.
      OFF
      Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_OFF.
      ON
      Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON.
      RESETTING
      This is the state that BleManager is in after calling BleManager.reset().
      SCANNING
      This is the state that BleManager is in when scanning actually starts.
      SCANNING_PAUSED
      This is the state that BleManager is in when scanning has been paused (but will resume).
      STARTING_SCAN
      This is the state that BleManager is in after calling BleManager.startScan() or related overloads.
      TURNING_OFF
      Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_OFF.
      TURNING_ON
      Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_ON.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int FULL_MASK
      Full bitwise mask made by ORing all BleManagerState instances together.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int bit()
      Returns the bit (0x1, 0x2, 0x4, etc.) this enum represents based on the Flag.ordinal().
      boolean didEnter​(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Given an old and new state mask, for example from DeviceStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.DeviceStateListener.StateEvent) or ManagerStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.ManagerStateListener.StateEvent), this method tells you whether the the 'this' state was appended.
      boolean didExit​(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Reverse of State.didEnter(int, int).
      int getNativeCode()
      Returns the analogous native code, if applicable.
      boolean isNull()
      Returns true if this state is meant to stand in for Java's built-in null.
      int or​(int bits)
      Does a bitwise OR for this state and the given bits.
      int or​(BitwiseEnum state)
      Does a bitwise OR for this state and the given state.
      boolean overlaps​(int mask)
      Convenience method for checking if (Flag.bit() & mask) != 0x0.

      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static BleManagerState[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • OFF

        public static final BleManagerState OFF
        Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_OFF.

      • TURNING_ON

        public static final BleManagerState TURNING_ON
        Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_ON.

      • ON

        public static final BleManagerState ON
        Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON.

      • TURNING_OFF

        public static final BleManagerState TURNING_OFF
        Analogous to BluetoothAdapter.STATE_TURNING_OFF.

      • IDLE

        public static final BleManagerState IDLE
        This is the state that BleManager is in when the update loop tick interval has been lowered, due to there being no tasks in the queue for a time dictated by BleManagerConfig.minTimeToIdle.

      • STARTING_SCAN

        public static final BleManagerState STARTING_SCAN
        This is the state that BleManager is in after calling BleManager.startScan() or related overloads. The BleManager will only be in this state for a very short period before moving to SCANNING.
        See Also:
        BleManager.startScan()

      • BOOST_SCANNING

        public static final BleManagerState BOOST_SCANNING
        This is the state that BleManager is in when BleManagerConfig.scanClassicBoostLength is not null, or Interval.DISABLED. No devices will be discovered when in this state, it's simply here to make the BLE scan give more reliable results, especially when looking for many devices. If you explicitly start a Bluetooth Classic scan, the manager will not enter this state.

      • SCANNING

        public static final BleManagerState SCANNING
        This is the state that BleManager is in when scanning actually starts.

      • SCANNING_PAUSED

        public static final BleManagerState SCANNING_PAUSED
        This is the state that BleManager is in when scanning has been paused (but will resume). This is mainly used with any of the startPeriodicScan methods in BleManager.

      • BLE_SCAN_READY

        public static final BleManagerState BLE_SCAN_READY
        This state dictates that all permissions (if needed) have been granted to allow BLE scanning to return results. See BluetoothEnabler.

      • RESETTING

        public static final BleManagerState RESETTING
        This is the state that BleManager is in after calling BleManager.reset().

    • Field Detail

      • FULL_MASK

        public static final int FULL_MASK
        Full bitwise mask made by ORing all BleManagerState instances together.

      • VALUES

        public static BleManagerState[] VALUES()

      • getNativeCode

        public int getNativeCode()
        Returns the analogous native code, if applicable. For example BluetoothAdapter.STATE_OFF, BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON, etc. RESETTING and SCANNING do not have a native code equivalent and will return 0.
